Woolly Mammoth: I would bring back the Woolly Mammoth because it was a fascinating animal with many unique features. It was the largest land mammal that ever existed, and its shaggy fur would be perfect for cold weather climates. I would also love to see how it would interact with the modern world.

Tasmanian Tiger: I would bring back the Tasmanian Tiger because it was a unique and mysterious animal. It had stripes like a tiger but was also covered in fur like a bear. I would love to see how it would adapt to the modern world and what kind of impact it would have on the ecosystem.

Dodo: I would bring back the Dodo because it was a cute and quirky animal that became extinct due to human activity. I would love to see how it would adapt to the modern world and what kind of impact it would have on the ecosystem.

Woolly Rhino: I would bring back the Woolly Rhino because it was a fascinating animal with many unique features. It had long, shaggy fur that made it look like a giant teddy bear, and its horn was made of ossified cartilage. I would love to see how it would adapt to the modern world and what kind of impact it would have on the ecosystem.

Saber-Toothed Tiger: I would bring back the Saber-Toothed Tiger because it was a powerful and fearsome predator. It had long, sharp teeth that it used to hunt and kill prey, and its muscular body made it a formidable opponent. I would love to see how it would adapt to the modern world and what kind of impact it would have on the ecosystem.
